title: Oakley launches personalised sunglasses
content:
Will Strickson
27 Jan 2021

Oakley Custom programme lets you customise up to six pieces in more than 30 styles including Jawbreaker, Sutro and Radar EV

Oakley has launched a sunglasses personalisation programme allowing customers to customise up to six pieces on more than 30 styles including iconic models like the Jawbreaker, Sutro and Radar EV.

Oakley Custom lets you choose a model of either sports, lifestyle or youth glasses and pick the colours of the frame, lens, icon and ear socks as well as giving you a choice of lens type.

You can also add a small etching on the lens of up to 15 characters if you want to make them even more unmistakably yours or match your club.

With all the different options there are over 40 million possible combinations so you won't have any issue standing out or having a new pair to match each kit combination (it's not excessive if it's necessary).

Cyclist Magazine Podcast Episode 16 – Alex Dowsett and how Covid stole his Hour Record attempt
Cycling time-trials: the complete how-to guide
Cyclist magazine issue 110: on sale now!

The Oakley Custom programme is available at oakley.com now and in Oakley shops and select Sunglass Huts once they reopen.

Prices will vary depending on which lens type and colour you select and the etching adds £15. To find out more and start customising visit oakley.com.

This might be the perfect opportunity to design your own club kit. If you want to customise clothing at the same time, Rapha Custom lets you design jerseys, bibshorts, base layers, gilets, arm warmers and t-shirts.

Glasses
author: wstrickson
